properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are currently monitoring a couple of lines of thunderstorms on either side of the Humber Valley. These thunderstorms have the potential to become severe with damaging hail and torrential rain. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-08-13T23:04:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-13T17:06:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2731155073.2019
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Gros Morne, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: Sasktel Service Outage In Rocanville, Welwyn, And Surrounding Area
properties.Summary:
Description: UPDATE: SaskTel is currently experiencing a service outage that is affecting Internet, Cellular, and Home Phone services in and around Rocanville. In addition, Home Phone services in and around Welwyn are also impacted. SaskTel crews have arrived on scene and are working to restores services as soon as possible.
Expires: 2019-08-13T22:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK SaskTel, 2019-08-12T17:21:43-06:00, B3A0CAF4-23D3-1366-4ABA-67FE4F7C519D
Area: Rocanville and Welwyn
properties.Author: SK SaskTel

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The South Okanagan region is being impacted or is likely to be impacted by wildfire smoke over the next 24-48 hours. Local smoke is anticipated from the Eagle Bluffs wildfire. During a wildfire, smoke conditions can change quickly over short distances and can vary considerably hour-by-hour. Wildfire smoke is a natural part of our environment but it is important to be mindful that exposure to smoke may affect your health. People with pre-existing health conditions, the elderly, pregnant women and infants, children, and sensitive individuals are more likely to experience health effects from smoke exposure. The bulletin can be accessed online at: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/ air/air-quality/air-advisories. The next bulletin update will be available August 13, 2019. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-08-13T23:42:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-08-13T07:43:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4142326854.2019
Area: South Okanagan
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By Town Of Lanigan.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Town of Lanigan. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Town of Lanigan water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2019-08-20T16:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Lanigan, 2019-08-12T09:20:25-06:00, A164C642-F5B0-B906-419C-906A8AA3ED0C
Area: Town of Lanigan
properties.Author: SK Lanigan
